alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 1:28PM CST until January 03 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 PM MST MONDAY... * WHAT...Freezing drizzle expected, followed by heavy snow. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches. Ice accumulations up to one tenth of an inch possible. * WHERE...Kimball, Morrill, and Cheyenne counties in the southern Nebraska Panhandle. This includes but is not limited to Kimball, Bridgeport, and Sidney. The worst icing due to freezing drizzle is expected over Cheyenne County. * WHEN...5 PM MST this evening until 11 PM MST Monday. The most likely time period for freezing drizzle will be overnight through mid-day Monday. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions due to icy, snow packed roads and significantly reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
